newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bonn knows nothing of Yeltsin Parkinson's report.
newsitem.headline: Bonn knows nothing of Yeltsin Parkinson's report.

text.p: German government officials said on Monday they knew nothing of a report in the mass-circulation daily Bild saying they were concerned Russia's ailing president Boris Yeltsin might have Parkinson's Disease.
The report said symptoms such as facial rigidity, a slowing down of limb movements and uncontrolled mouth movements had increased over the last two years.
But chancellery officials who declined to be named said they had heard of nothing to back up the report.
Yeltsin, who had heart bypass surgery late last year and is now recovering from a bout of pneumonia, has cancelled a visit to the Netherlands on doctors' advice.

He had been due to hold talks on February 4 with Dutch Prime Minister Wim Kok, who currently holds the rotating six-month presidency of the European Union. But a Kremlin spokesman said on Monday that doctors advised Yeltsin to refrain from air travel and to work at home.
Yeltsin's aides say he is following affairs of state and working on papers, including an address to both houses of the Russian parliament due to be delivered next month.
